hanzi-su-wiki:
舗

Значения

Мостить; лавка, магазин

Мнемоника

Дорога мостилась сначала у домов 舎 уважаемых людей 甫.

Варианты

舖, 鋪, 铺
purpleculture_pinyin:
pù
Japanese variant of 铺
Японский вариант магазина
rtega_mnemonic:
舖舖RS
铺铺		舗store, shop, lay out
  • house with a lot of chatter 舍/舎 where produce from the field 甫 are laid out and sold for money 钅
heisig_constituent: shop, cottage, little-thatch, umbrella, earthenware jar, lidded crock, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, dog-tag, arrowhead, screwdriver, utilize, utilise
heisig_story: Cottage . . . dog tag. The key word refers to the noun, not the verb.
koohiiStory1: A shop in an impoverished country is just a cottage with a dog tag identifying it.
koohiiStory2: Normal cottages (舎 actually means a building) don´t have tags advertising their names, but shops do.
jp_example_words: 舗装(ほそう): pavement, road surface
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You want to have a quaint cottage wedding, so you have to go to the cottage wedding shop to get everything you need. This shop is the only place you can buy everything you need. It's not like you can make a cottage from scratch!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself walking into the cottage wedding shop. Look at all the different cottages you get to choose from. And there's wedding cake too?! This shop has everything!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You're browsing everything in the shop when a garden hoe (ほ) catches your eye. Yes. This will make your cottage wedding the absolute best one. The hoe will give you away at your wedding.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine walking around the shop and then falling in love with a hoe with pretty tassels and flowers attached to it. Yes, it's only for decoration, but you're going to buy and use it during your cottage wedding.
Ru_Notes: Двойной смысл происходит, похоже, от того, что товары в магазине раскладывают, покрывая ими прилавок. 商品を並べて売る所。店。

    舗装ほそう
  • покрытие, дорожное покрытие
    • 舗道ほどう
  • мостовая

    本舗ほんぽ
  • (See 本店・1) head office, main shop
    • edict2

  • unpaved, unsurfaced
    • edict2

Kanshudo_mnemonic: your first time (甫) at the house (舎) you stop at the pavement

舗装(ほそう): pavement, road surface

舗字的基本解释

舗
pù
古同“舖2”。

舗字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pū］
(1)舒展。
(2)“舖”的日本用简体汉字。
[②]［pù］
量词。十里为一铺。

舗字的康熙字典解释
舗字的源字形

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
舗字的起名意思

暂无。

quantifier. Ten miles is a shop.

pù
яп. вм. 铺
Radicals: 舎, 甫  (cottage, wedding)
Meaning Mnemonic
You want to have a quaint cottage wedding, so you have to go to the cottage wedding shop to get everything you need. This shop is the only place you can buy everything you need. It's not like you can make a cottage from scratch!
Picture yourself walking into the cottage wedding shop. Look at all the different cottages you get to choose from. And there's wedding cake too?! This shop has everything!
Reading Mnemonic
You're browsing everything in the shop when a garden hoe (ほ) catches your eye. Yes. This will make your cottage wedding the absolute best one. The hoe will give you away at your wedding.
Imagine walking around the shop and then falling in love with a hoe with pretty tassels and flowers attached to it. Yes, it's only for decoration, but you're going to buy and use it during your cottage wedding.
